info.title: The v4 API
info.description: # Introduction The v4 API is a multi-capable web API based on the [API Platform](https://api-platform.com/) framework, built to support the future generation of the [Goteo](https://goteo.org) crowdfunding platform, aiming to be it's new underlying engine. v4 exposes a REST API with predictable and resource-oriented URLs, accepts request bodies (payloads) encoded in multiple open standard formats such as JSON, including [JSON-LD](https://json-ld.org/) and [Hydra](https://www.hydra-cg.com/), returns responses encoded in the same formats, and uses standard HTTP verbs and status codes. This API is documented in the OpenApi initiative [Specification v3.1.0](https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0), which allows v4 to be easily understood by API development suites, documentation generators and SDK generators for the convenience of developers and API users. Most of the spec is generated automatically as changes are introduced, but some additional content such as this introduction and other sections might not be updated as regularly. This API is still in early development and is not set to have backward compatibility with the Goteo API v1 (http://api.goteo.org/v1/). Major changes are to be expected. # Authentication The v4 API uses Access Tokens to authenticate requests. To use a Token, include it in the `Authorization` header using the [Bearer](https://swagger.io/docs/specification/authentication/bearer-authentication/) strategy. ```sh curl -X 'GET' \ 'https://api.goteo.org/v4/projects?page=1' \ -H 'accept: application/json' \ -H 'Authorization: Bearer ' ``` UserTokens exist under an User's scope, when you obtain a token this will only grant you as much permissions as the User under which it was created. To obtain a UserToken you must send a POST request to [/v4/user_tokens](/v4/user_tokens) with the User login credentials (identifier and password) in the payload. If the credentials are correct a UserToken will be created, the `token` property value of which you must include in future requests. Users can delete UserTokens owned by them at any moment, revoking your application's access to the v4 API on their behalf. When a UserToken fails to authenticate a request you will receive a 401 Unauthorized response from the API, at which point your application must look to get a new UserToken from the User. # Localization The v4 API accepts localization of content. Resources such as Projects can have owner-submitted data (title, description, etc) in different languages, the extent of which is subject to the owner. Resources with localized content versions will expose a `locales` property listing the available localizations. Retrieval of content in different locales is performed via standard HTTP [content negotiation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Content_negotiation). When the request supplies an `Accept-Language` header, the API will retrieve localized versions of the content where available, falling back to the default locale of the API instance, and finally to the first available localization of the content regardless of the request preferences or the API defaults if it cannot find suitable localizations. Submission of localized content is performed over standard REST content submission with the addition of a `Content-Language` header to a POST, PUT or PATCH request. Only the first tag will be used to determine the submitted localization. When a localizable resource is created with a non-localized request (a request without a `Content-Language` header), the default locale of the API instance is used. Removal of localized content is performed over standard REST content deletion with the addition of a `Content-Language` header to a DELETE request. A delete request for localized content will act partially and remove only the requested localizations, not the entire resource. To remove the resource you can send a non-localized request. Unlike on submission v4 will process all language tags included in the header and remove every matching localization. Localizations are assumed to be one per language globally. Language tags will be parsed to match to an [ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639_language_codes) two-letter languade code, e.g: a value of "en_US, en_GB" will be converted to "en", ignoring the "US" and "GB" subtags.

Accounting.description:
v4 features an advanced economy model under the hood.
Accountings are implemented as a common interface for issuing and receiving Transactions,
which allows different resources to have money-capabalities.
\
\
Many different actions can trigger changes in Accountings, such as GatewayCheckouts being successfully charged.

owner.description: IRI of the resource owning this Accounting.

currency.description:
The preferred currency for monetary operations.\
3-letter ISO 4217 currency code.

Accounting.jsonld.description:
v4 features an advanced economy model under the hood.
Accountings are implemented as a common interface for issuing and receiving Transactions,
which allows different resources to have money-capabalities.
\
\
Many different actions can trigger changes in Accountings, such as GatewayCheckouts being successfully charged.

owner.description: IRI of the resource owning this Accounting.

currency.description:
The preferred currency for monetary operations.\
3-letter ISO 4217 currency code.

AccountingBalancePoint.description:
AccountingBalancePoints represent a dated aggregate Accounting balance.\
\
Each point is the sum of money at incoming and outgoing transactions in an Accounting for a period of time,
you can query multiple balance points to obtain the evolution of the Accounting's balance over time.

start.description: The start date for items aggregated in this point.

end.description: The end date for items aggregated in this point. Not inclusive.

balance.description: Resulting balance for items in this point.

length.description: The number of items aggregated in this point.

AccountingBalancePoint.jsonld.description:
AccountingBalancePoints represent a dated aggregate Accounting balance.\
\
Each point is the sum of money at incoming and outgoing transactions in an Accounting for a period of time,
you can query multiple balance points to obtain the evolution of the Accounting's balance over time.

start.description: The start date for items aggregated in this point.

end.description: The end date for items aggregated in this point. Not inclusive.

balance.description: Resulting balance for items in this point.

length.description: The number of items aggregated in this point.

AccountingTransaction.description:
AccountingTransactions represent a movement of money from one Accounting (origin) into another (target).\
\
When a transaction targets an Accounting it means that the Accounting receives it, this will add to that Accounting.
When a transaction originates from an Accounting the Accounting issues the transaction and it will deduct from it if,
specially when the transaction comes from a GatewayCharge processed by the `wallet` Gateway.\
\
AccountingTransactions are generated for each GatewayCharge in a GatewayCheckout once it becomes successful.

money.description: The monetary value received at target and issued at origin.

origin.description: The Accounting from which the Transaction comes from.

target.description: The Accounting where the Transaction goes to.

AccountingTransaction.jsonld.description:
AccountingTransactions represent a movement of money from one Accounting (origin) into another (target).\
\
When a transaction targets an Accounting it means that the Accounting receives it, this will add to that Accounting.
When a transaction originates from an Accounting the Accounting issues the transaction and it will deduct from it if,
specially when the transaction comes from a GatewayCharge processed by the `wallet` Gateway.\
\
AccountingTransactions are generated for each GatewayCharge in a GatewayCheckout once it becomes successful.

money.description: The monetary value received at target and issued at origin.

origin.description: The Accounting from which the Transaction comes from.

target.description: The Accounting where the Transaction goes to.

minimum.description: A summary of the minimum budget. As described by items with specified minimum money.

optimum.description: A summary of the optimum, minimum included, budget. As described by items with specified optimum money plus minimum money.

minimum.description: A summary of the minimum budget. As described by items with specified minimum money.

optimum.description: A summary of the optimum, minimum included, budget. As described by items with specified optimum money plus minimum money.

money.description: The total money by the included items.
The total money by the included items.

propertyPath.description: The property path of the violation

message.description: The message associated with the violation

propertyPath.description: The property path of the violation

message.description: The message associated with the violation

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type

Gateway.description:
Gateways represent payment services used to perform the necessary payments for Transactions between Accounts.\
\
For each Gateway there is an internal implementation that handles the creation and validation of Transactions between Accounts.
These implementations make use of external or internal services to gather the funds that are inside a Transaction,
perform corroboration of funds and store the Transactions into the system.

Gateway.jsonld.description:
Gateways represent payment services used to perform the necessary payments for Transactions between Accounts.\
\
For each Gateway there is an internal implementation that handles the creation and validation of Transactions between Accounts.
These implementations make use of external or internal services to gather the funds that are inside a Transaction,
perform corroboration of funds and store the Transactions into the system.

GatewayCharge.description: A Charge represents a payment item to be included in a Checkout for payment at a Gateway.

checkout.description: The Checkout to which this Charge item belongs to.

type.description:
How this item should be processed by the Gateway.\
\
`single` is for one time payments.\
`recurring` is for payments repeated over time.

title.description:
A short, descriptive string for this charge item.\
May be displayed to the payer.

description.description:
Detailed information about the charge item.\
May be displayed to the payer.

target.description: The Accounting receiving the money after a successful payment.

money.description: The money to-be-paid for this item at the Gateway.

status.description: The status of the charge item with the Gateway.

GatewayCharge.ChargeUpdationDto.description: A Charge represents a payment item to be included in a Checkout for payment at a Gateway.

id.description: The unique identifier for the GatewayCharge.

status.description: To ask for a refund, set the status `to_refund`.

GatewayCharge.jsonld.description: A Charge represents a payment item to be included in a Checkout for payment at a Gateway.

checkout.description: The Checkout to which this Charge item belongs to.

type.description:

\

`recurring` is for payments repeated over time.

title.description:

description.description:

target.description: The Accounting receiving the money after a successful payment.

money.description: The money to-be-paid for this item at the Gateway.

status.description: The status of the charge item with the Gateway.

GatewayCheckout.description: A GatewayCheckout represents a payment session with a Gateway.

gateway.description: The desired Gateway to checkout with.

origin.description: The Accounting paying for the charges.

charges.description: A list of the payment items to be charged to the origin.

returnUrl.description:
Gateways will redirect the user back to the v4 API,
which will then redirect the user to this address.\
\
An URL query param `checkoutId` with the Checkout ID value
will be appended on the redirection.

refund.description:
The strategy chosen by the User to decide where the money will go to
in the event that one Charge needs to be returned.

status.description: The status of this Checkout, as confirmed by the Gateway.

links.description: A list of related hyperlinks, as provided by the Gateway.

trackings.description: A list of related tracking codes and numbers, as provided by the Gateway.

GatewayCheckout.CheckoutUpdationDto.description: A GatewayCheckout represents a payment session with a Gateway.

refund.description:
The strategy chosen by the User to decide where the money will go to
in the event that one Charge needs to be returned.

gateway.description: The desired Gateway to checkout with.

origin.description: The Accounting paying for the charges.

returnUrl.description:

which will then redirect the user to this address.\
\

status.description: The status of this Checkout, as confirmed by the Gateway.

links.description: A list of related hyperlinks, as provided by the Gateway.

trackings.description: A list of related tracking codes and numbers, as provided by the Gateway.

rel.description: The link relation type, which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link.

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

type.description:
The type of the link indicates who is the intended user of a link.\
`debug` links are for developers and platform maintainers to get useful information about the checkout.\
`payment` links are for end-users who must visit this link to complete the checkout.

rel.description: The link relation type, which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link.

MatchCall.description:
A MatchCall is a managed event which accepts MatchCallSubmissions from Projects to receive *matchfunding* financement.
This means money going to a Project in a MatchCall can be matched with funds from the MatchCall accounting.
\
\
MatchCallSubmissions from Projects can be accepted or rejected by the managers.
\
\
How and when does a MatchCall match funds is determined by the MatchStrategy.
Everytime there is a Charge item going to a Project accepted in a MatchCall the strategy is evaluated for matching.
The strategy defines a series of rules that determine if the Charge is eligible for triggering the matching of funds.
When a Charge is to be matched the strategy uses a MatchFormula,
which is a predefined implementation for common mathematical operations used to match money.
The formula is fine-tuned in the strategy by defining the variables in the formula.

accounting.description: The Accounting which holds and spends the funds for this MatchCall.

strategies.description: The MatchStrategies define the matching behaviour for this MatchCall.

submissions.description: A list of the MatchCallSubmissions received by this MatchCall.

managers.description: A list of Users who can modify this MatchCall.

title.description: Main display title.

territory.description: Codes for the territory of interest in this MatchCall.

status.description: The current status of the MatchCall.

MatchCall.jsonld.description:
A MatchCall is a managed event which accepts MatchCallSubmissions from Projects to receive *matchfunding* financement.
This means money going to a Project in a MatchCall can be matched with funds from the MatchCall accounting.
\
\
MatchCallSubmissions from Projects can be accepted or rejected by the managers.
\
\
How and when does a MatchCall match funds is determined by the MatchStrategy.
Everytime there is a Charge item going to a Project accepted in a MatchCall the strategy is evaluated for matching.
The strategy defines a series of rules that determine if the Charge is eligible for triggering the matching of funds.
When a Charge is to be matched the strategy uses a MatchFormula,
which is a predefined implementation for common mathematical operations used to match money.
The formula is fine-tuned in the strategy by defining the variables in the formula.

accounting.description: The Accounting which holds and spends the funds for this MatchCall.

strategies.description: The MatchStrategies define the matching behaviour for this MatchCall.

submissions.description: A list of the MatchCallSubmissions received by this MatchCall.

managers.description: A list of Users who can modify this MatchCall.

title.description: Main display title.

territory.description: Codes for the territory of interest in this MatchCall.

status.description: The current status of the MatchCall.

MatchCallSubmission.description: MatchCallSubmissions represent the will of a Project to be held under a MatchCall and receive matchfunding financement.

call.description: The MatchCall to which this MatchCallSubmission belongs to.

project.description: The Project that applied for the MatchCall.

status.description:
The status of the Project's application for the MatchCall.\
Only MatchCallSubmissions with an status `accepted` will receive matchfunding.

MatchCallSubmission.MatchCallSubmissionC.description: MatchCallSubmissions represent the will of a Project to be held under a MatchCall and receive matchfunding financement.

call.description: The MatchCall to which this MatchCallSubmission belongs to.

project.description: The Project that applied for the MatchCall.

MatchFormula.description:
A MatchFormula is a predefined code implementation for matching funds in Transactions under a MatchCall.
MatchFormulas can be chosen by the managers in a MatchCall and their behaviour fine-tuned.

expression.description: The underlying math expressed as a common-notation formula.

MatchFormula.jsonld.description:
A MatchFormula is a predefined code implementation for matching funds in Transactions under a MatchCall.
MatchFormulas can be chosen by the managers in a MatchCall and their behaviour fine-tuned.

expression.description: The underlying math expressed as a common-notation formula.

MatchRule.description:
A MatchRule is a predefined code implementation for validating
that a match making condition is met when there is a Charge to be matched.

description.description: A plain-text description about what the rules validates for.

MatchRule.jsonld.description:
A MatchRule is a predefined code implementation for validating
that a match making condition is met when there is a Charge to be matched.

description.description: A plain-text description about what the rules validates for.

MatchStrategy.description:
A MatchStrategy defines how will a MatchCall perform the match-making process.
\
The match-making flow is:
1. A Project accepted in a MatchCall receives a successful Charge.
2. The match-making loads the MatchCall's MatchStrategies.
3. For each MatchStrategy the rules are executed, if one rule fails the match-making is cancelled for the strategy.
3. The first valid MatchStrategy's formula function is passed the respective limit, factor and money of the MatchAgainst.
4. The result of the MatchStrategy formula function execution is put in a Transaction from the MatchCall to the Project.

call.description: The MatchCall to which this strategy belongs to.

ranking.description:
The ranking is the index order of this strategy among the others of the MatchCall
when this is up for match making. The ranking value of items will be sorted
after each change in the number of strategies or the ranking values.

rules.description: The MatchRules used to decide if the match making strategy should be executed or not.

formula.description: The MatchFormula used to calculate matched funds.

limit.description: The assigned maximum amount of funding that will be given by the MatchFormula per operation.

factor.description: The `x` factor used to calculate the resulting match of funds with the MatchFormula.

against.description:
The money to be matched by the formula is
- `charge` the money in the Charge item
- `budget_min` the minimum in the Project's budget
- `budget_opt` the optimum in the Project's budget.

MatchStrategy.jsonld.description:
A MatchStrategy defines how will a MatchCall perform the match-making process.
\
The match-making flow is:
1. A Project accepted in a MatchCall receives a successful Charge.
2. The match-making loads the MatchCall's MatchStrategies.
3. For each MatchStrategy the rules are executed, if one rule fails the match-making is cancelled for the strategy.
3. The first valid MatchStrategy's formula function is passed the respective limit, factor and money of the MatchAgainst.
4. The result of the MatchStrategy formula function execution is put in a Transaction from the MatchCall to the Project.

amount.description:
An amount of currency.\
Expressed as the minor unit, e.g: cents, pennies, etc.

An amount of currency.\
Expressed as the minor unit, e.g: cents, pennies, etc.

Organization.description:
Sometimes an Organization is behind a User account,
we keep their data separated from the User record to allow for other User types,
like the ones owned by an individual, to exist all at the same level.\
\
All Organization records are only visible to their respective owners and platform admins.
Sensitive data is encrypted before being stored in the database.

taxId.description: ID for tax purposes. e.g: NIF (formerly CIF), Umsatzsteuer-Id, EID, etc.

legalName.description:
Organization legal name before government,
as it appears on legal documents issued by or for this organization.\
Will be used as last option for the display name of the User.

businessName.description:
The name under which the organization presents itself.\
Might be similar to the legal name or completely different.\
Will be used as display name for the User when present.

Organization.jsonld.description:
Sometimes an Organization is behind a User account,
we keep their data separated from the User record to allow for other User types,
like the ones owned by an individual, to exist all at the same level.\
\
All Organization records are only visible to their respective owners and platform admins.
Sensitive data is encrypted before being stored in the database.

taxId.description: ID for tax purposes. e.g: NIF (formerly CIF), Umsatzsteuer-Id, EID, etc.

legalName.description:

as it appears on legal documents issued by or for this organization.\
Will be used as last option for the display name of the User.

businessName.description:
The name under which the organization presents itself.\
Might be similar to the legal name or completely different.\

Person.description:
Most times a real person is behind a User account,
we keep their data separated from the User record to allow for other User types,
like the ones owned by an organization, to exist all at the same level.\
\
All Person records are only visible to their respective owners and platform admins.
Sensitive personal data is encrypted before being stored in the database.

taxId.description: Personal ID for tax purposes. e.g: NIF, Steuer-ID, SSN, ITIN, etc.

firstName.description:
First-part of the name of the person,
in most western conventions this is the given name(s). e.g: John, Juan, etc.

lastName.description:
Last-part of the name of the person,
in most western conventions this is the family name(s). e.g: Smith, Herrera Garc√≠a, etc.

Most times a real person is behind a User account,

time.description: The req-res time difference in milliseconds.
The req-res time difference in milliseconds.

Project.description: Projects describe a User-owned, community-led event that is to be discovered, developed and funded by the community.

slug.description: A unique, non white space, string identifier for this Project.

accounting.description: The Accounting holding the funds raised by this Project.

owner.description: The User who owns this Project.

title.description: Main headline for the Project.

deadline.description:
On `minimum`, Project will campaign until the minimum deadline.\
On `optimum`, Project will campaing until the minimum deadline,
and then until the optimum deadline if it did raise the minimum.

categories.description: A list of the available categories most relevant to this Project.

territory.description: ISO 3166 data about the Project's territory of interest.

description.description: Free-form rich text description for the Project.

video.description: Extracted embedding data from the Project's video.

status.description: The status of a Project represents how far it is in it's life-cycle.

rewards.description: List of the ProjectRewards this Project offers.

budget.description: A detailed breakdown of the budget for this Project, as described by the associated BudgetItems.

budgetItems.description: A list of the BudgetItems composing the budget of this Project.

updates.description: A list of the ProjectUpdates this Project has.

locales.description: List of the available content locales.

Project.ProjectCreationDto.description: Projects describe a User-owned, community-led event that is to be discovered, developed and funded by the community.

title.description: Main headline for the Project. Must include at least one character between a-Z.

release.description:
Desired date-time of release for the created Project.\
By default 28 days from now, at minimum 14 days from now.

Project.ProjectCreationDto.jsonld.description: Projects describe a User-owned, community-led event that is to be discovered, developed and funded by the community.

title.description: Main headline for the Project. Must include at least one character between a-Z.

release.description:
Desired date-time of release for the created Project.\
By default 28 days from now, at minimum 14 days from now.

Project.ProjectUpdationDto.description: Projects describe a User-owned, community-led event that is to be discovered, developed and funded by the community.

title.description: Main headline for the Project.

territory.description: ISO 3166 data about the Project's territory of interest.

description.description: Free-form rich text description for the Project.

deadline.description:
On `minimum`, Project will campaign until the minimum deadline.\
On `optimum`, Project will campaing until the minimum deadline,
and then until the optimum deadline if it did raise the minimum.

video.description: A URL to a video showcasing the Project.

status.description: The status of a Project represents how far it is in it's life-cycle.

Project.jsonld.description: Projects describe a User-owned, community-led event that is to be discovered, developed and funded by the community.

slug.description: A unique, non white space, string identifier for this Project.

accounting.description: The Accounting holding the funds raised by this Project.

owner.description: The User who owns this Project.

title.description: Main headline for the Project.

deadline.description:
On `minimum`, Project will campaign until the minimum deadline.\
On `optimum`, Project will campaing until the minimum deadline,
and then until the optimum deadline if it did raise the minimum.

categories.description: A list of the available categories most relevant to this Project.

territory.description: ISO 3166 data about the Project's territory of interest.

description.description: Free-form rich text description for the Project.

video.description: Extracted embedding data from the Project's video.

status.description: The status of a Project represents how far it is in it's life-cycle.

rewards.description: List of the ProjectRewards this Project offers.

budget.description: A detailed breakdown of the budget for this Project, as described by the associated BudgetItems.

budgetItems.description: A list of the BudgetItems composing the budget of this Project.

updates.description: A list of the ProjectUpdates this Project has.

locales.description: List of the available content locales.

ProjectBudgetItem.description:
A Project's budget is composed via BudgetItem records.\
\
Each BudgetItem describes one specific monetary necessity. The total budget of a Project is then calculated from the related BudgetItems.

type.description: The type of need this item solves.

title.description: A short, descriptive string for the item.

money.description: The amount of money required for this item.

deadline.description: Defines the budget category for this item within the project.

locales.description: List of the available content locales.

ProjectBudgetItem.jsonld.description:
A Project's budget is composed via BudgetItem records.\
\
Each BudgetItem describes one specific monetary necessity. The total budget of a Project is then calculated from the related BudgetItems.

type.description: The type of need this item solves.

title.description: A short, descriptive string for the item.

money.description: The amount of money required for this item.

deadline.description: Defines the budget category for this item within the project.

locales.description: List of the available content locales.

release.description: The date at which the Project started campaigning.

minimum.description:
40 days after the date of release.\
\
The minimum budget must be raised by the end of this date.\
Failure to do so will move the Project out of status `in_campaign` into status `unfunded`.

optimum.description:
40 days after the minimum deadline. Optional.\
\
If the Project achieved their minimum budget by the minimum deadline,
and this deadline is defined, it may still remain in campaign to raise the optimum.

release.description: The date at which the Project started campaigning.

minimum.description:
40 days after the date of release.\
\
The minimum budget must be raised by the end of this date.\
Failure to do so will move the Project out of status `in_campaign` into status `unfunded`.

optimum.description:
40 days after the minimum deadline. Optional.\
\
If the Project achieved their minimum budget by the minimum deadline,
and this deadline is defined, it may still remain in campaign to raise the optimum.

ProjectCollaboration.description: ProjectCollaborations are used as requests for help on specific problems that the Project might face and cannot be budgeted-in.

project.description: The Project which requests this collaboration.

title.description: A short, descriptive title for this collaboration.

description.description: Information about this collaboration. More detailed than the title.

isFulfilled.description: Wether or not the collaboration's problem has been solved.

locales.description: List of the available content locales.

ProjectCollaboration.jsonld.description: ProjectCollaborations are used as requests for help on specific problems that the Project might face and cannot be budgeted-in.

project.description: The Project which requests this collaboration.

title.description: A short, descriptive title for this collaboration.

description.description: Information about this collaboration. More detailed than the title.

isFulfilled.description: Wether or not the collaboration's problem has been solved.

locales.description: List of the available content locales.

ProjectReward.description: A ProjectReward is something the Project owner wishes to give in exchange for contributions to their Project.

project.description: The project which gives this reward.

title.description: A short, descriptive title for this reward.

description.description: Information about this reward. More detailed than the title.

money.description: The minimal monetary sum to be able to claim this reward.

isFinite.description: Rewards might be finite, i.e: has a limited amount of existing unitsTotal.

unitsTotal.description:
For finite rewards, the total amount of existing units.\
Required if `isFinite`.

unitsClaimed.description: The total amount of claims on this Reward.

unitsAvailable.description: For finite rewards, the currently available amount of units that can be claimed.

locales.description: List of the available content locales.

ProjectRewardClaim.description: A ProjectRewardClaim represents the will of an User who wishes to obtain one ProjectReward.

charge.description: The GatewayCharge granting access to the ProjectReward.

ProjectSupport.description:
ProjectSupports gather Transactions going from one same origin to one same Project.\
\
MatchCalls specially might make several different Transactions to the same Project,
but their ProjectSupport remains the same just with updated money.

origin.description:
The Accounting of origin for the Transactions under this ProjectSupport record.\
\
When `anonymous` is *true* it will only be public to admins and the User.

transactions.description: The Transactions that were issued to the Project by the origin.

money.description: The total monetary value of the Transactions going to the Project.

anonymous.description: User's will to have their support to the Project be shown publicly.

message.description: A message of support from the User to the Project.

ProjectSupport.TotalizedMoney.description:
ProjectSupports gather Transactions going from one same origin to one same Project.\
\
MatchCalls specially might make several different Transactions to the same Project,
but their ProjectSupport remains the same just with updated money.

message.description: A message of support from the User to the Project.

ProjectUpdate.description:
A ProjectUpdate offers records of significant news during a Project's life.\
\
Updates can be for outstanding donation amounts, achievement of goals or thresholds,
or any other body of information that the Project owner(s) may wish to make public to the Project's audience.

project.description: The Project to which this update belongs to.

title.description: Main headline for this update.

body.description: Main text body of the Project's update.

date.description:
Public display date for this update,
not necessarily related to the actual dates of resource creation or update.

cover.description: URL to an image resource to be displayed as header.

locales.description: List of the available content locales.

A ProjectUpdate offers records of significant news during a Project's life.\

title.description: Main headline for this update.

body.description: Main text body of the Project's update.

date.description:

not necessarily related to the actual dates of resource creation or update.

cover.description: URL to an image resource to be displayed as header.

country.description:
ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 two-letter country code.\
e.g: ES (Spain).

subLvl1.description:
ISO 3166-2 first level subdivision code.\
e.g: ES-AN (Andaluc√≠a, Spain).

subLvl2.description:
ISO 3166-2 second level subdivision code.\
e.g: ES-GR (Granada, Andaluc√≠a, Spain).

Tipjar.description:
Unlike other Money recipients a Tipjar receives money with no further goal.\
\
Tips to the platform owners and other no-purpose money can target a Tipjar.

name.description: Human readable, non white space, unique string.

User.description: Users represent people who interact with the platform.

handle.description: A unique, non white space, byte-safe string identifier for this User.

avatar.description: URL to the avatar image of this User.

type.description: Is this User for an individual acting on their own or a group of individuals?

roles.description: A list of the roles assigned to this User. Admin scoped property.

person.description:
For `individual` User types: personal data about the User themselves.\
For `organization` User types: data for the organization representative or person managing the User.

organization.description: For `organization` User types only. Legal entity data.

accounting.description: The Accounting for this User monetary movements.

projects.description: The Projects that are owned by this User.

emailConfirmed.description: Has this User confirmed their email address?

active.description: A flag determined by the platform for Users who are known to be active.

password.description:
The auth password for the new User. Plaintext string,

UserToken.description:
UserTokens authenticate requests on behalf of the User who owns them.\
\
When a UserToken is created v4 generates a SHA-256 hash that is unique for each UserToken.
The value of a UserToken comes preceded by a 4-digit-length prefix based on the type of token it is.

owner.description: The User who this token grants access as.

UserToken.UserTokenLoginDto.description:
UserTokens authenticate requests on behalf of the User who owns them.\
\
When a UserToken is created v4 generates a SHA-256 hash that is unique for each UserToken.
The value of a UserToken comes preceded by a 4-digit-length prefix based on the type of token it is.

identifier.description: The identifier (email, handle) of the User to be authenticated.

password.description: The password of the User to be authenticated.

UserToken.UserTokenLoginDto.jsonld.description:
UserTokens authenticate requests on behalf of the User who owns them.\
\
When a UserToken is created v4 generates a SHA-256 hash that is unique for each UserToken.
The value of a UserToken comes preceded by a 4-digit-length prefix based on the type of token it is.

identifier.description: The identifier (email, handle) of the User to be authenticated.

password.description: The password of the User to be authenticated.

Version.description:
Some resources are versioned. This means v4 keeps track of the changes performed in subsets of specific properties within these resources.\
\
This allows us to keep track of the flow and the evolution of records in the platform.
Looking at the changes done between one version and the next one we can reconstruct how a resource was at a certain point in time.

id.description: The ID of the version record.

action.description: The type of action that performed the recorded changes.

resource.description: The type of the recorded resource.

resourceId.description: The ID of the recorded resource.

resourceVersion.description: The version number for this specific resource.

resourceChanges.description: The changed resource data, i.e the new values of the changed properties.

dateCreated.description: The date at which this version was created.

Version.jsonld.description:
Some resources are versioned. This means v4 keeps track of the changes performed in subsets of specific properties within these resources.\
\
This allows us to keep track of the flow and the evolution of records in the platform.
Looking at the changes done between one version and the next one we can reconstruct how a resource was at a certain point in time.

id.description: The ID of the version record.

action.description: The type of action that performed the recorded changes.

resource.description: The type of the recorded resource.

resourceId.description: The ID of the recorded resource.

resourceVersion.description: The version number for this specific resource.

resourceChanges.description: The changed resource data, i.e the new values of the changed properties.

dateCreated.description: The date at which this version was created.

tags.name: Accounting
tags.description:
v4 features an advanced economy model under the hood.
Accountings are implemented as a common interface for issuing and receiving Transactions,
which allows different resources to have money-capabalities.
\
\
Many different actions can trigger changes in Accountings, such as GatewayCheckouts being successfully charged.

tags.name: AccountingBalancePoint
tags.description:
AccountingBalancePoints represent a dated aggregate Accounting balance.\
\
Each point is the sum of money at incoming and outgoing transactions in an Accounting for a period of time,
you can query multiple balance points to obtain the evolution of the Accounting's balance over time.

tags.name: AccountingTransaction
tags.description:
AccountingTransactions represent a movement of money from one Accounting (origin) into another (target).\
\
When a transaction targets an Accounting it means that the Accounting receives it, this will add to that Accounting.
When a transaction originates from an Accounting the Accounting issues the transaction and it will deduct from it if,
specially when the transaction comes from a GatewayCharge processed by the `wallet` Gateway.\
\
AccountingTransactions are generated for each GatewayCharge in a GatewayCheckout once it becomes successful.

tags.name: ConstraintViolation-json
tags.description: Unprocessable entity

tags.name: Error
tags.description: A representation of common errors.

tags.name: Gateway
tags.description:
Gateways represent payment services used to perform the necessary payments for Transactions between Accounts.\
\
For each Gateway there is an internal implementation that handles the creation and validation of Transactions between Accounts.
These implementations make use of external or internal services to gather the funds that are inside a Transaction,
perform corroboration of funds and store the Transactions into the system.

tags.name: GatewayCharge
tags.description: A Charge represents a payment item to be included in a Checkout for payment at a Gateway.

tags.name: GatewayCheckout
tags.description: A GatewayCheckout represents a payment session with a Gateway.

tags.name: MatchCall
tags.description:
A MatchCall is a managed event which accepts MatchCallSubmissions from Projects to receive *matchfunding* financement.
This means money going to a Project in a MatchCall can be matched with funds from the MatchCall accounting.
\
\
MatchCallSubmissions from Projects can be accepted or rejected by the managers.
\
\
How and when does a MatchCall match funds is determined by the MatchStrategy.
Everytime there is a Charge item going to a Project accepted in a MatchCall the strategy is evaluated for matching.
The strategy defines a series of rules that determine if the Charge is eligible for triggering the matching of funds.
When a Charge is to be matched the strategy uses a MatchFormula,
which is a predefined implementation for common mathematical operations used to match money.
The formula is fine-tuned in the strategy by defining the variables in the formula.

tags.name: MatchCallSubmission
tags.description: MatchCallSubmissions represent the will of a Project to be held under a MatchCall and receive matchfunding financement.

tags.name: MatchFormula
tags.description:
A MatchFormula is a predefined code implementation for matching funds in Transactions under a MatchCall.
MatchFormulas can be chosen by the managers in a MatchCall and their behaviour fine-tuned.

tags.name: MatchRule
tags.description:
A MatchRule is a predefined code implementation for validating
that a match making condition is met when there is a Charge to be matched.

tags.name: MatchStrategy
tags.description:
A MatchStrategy defines how will a MatchCall perform the match-making process.
\
The match-making flow is:
1. A Project accepted in a MatchCall receives a successful Charge.
2. The match-making loads the MatchCall's MatchStrategies.
3. For each MatchStrategy the rules are executed, if one rule fails the match-making is cancelled for the strategy.
3. The first valid MatchStrategy's formula function is passed the respective limit, factor and money of the MatchAgainst.
4. The result of the MatchStrategy formula function execution is put in a Transaction from the MatchCall to the Project.

tags.name: Organization
tags.description:
Sometimes an Organization is behind a User account,
we keep their data separated from the User record to allow for other User types,
like the ones owned by an individual, to exist all at the same level.\
\
All Organization records are only visible to their respective owners and platform admins.
Sensitive data is encrypted before being stored in the database.

tags.name: Person
tags.description:
Most times a real person is behind a User account,
we keep their data separated from the User record to allow for other User types,
like the ones owned by an organization, to exist all at the same level.\
\
All Person records are only visible to their respective owners and platform admins.
Sensitive personal data is encrypted before being stored in the database.
